intro: Navicularia syriaca subsp. distans, commonly known as the Syrian navicula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Aizoaceae. It is a low-growing, succulent perennial that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in clusters during the spring or early summer. This subspecies is native to regions of the Middle East and is adapted to rocky and sandy soils.
